For wind illnesses, in summer one should take fatty, salty, sour, and hot foods. In the summer months, the pores are open, so using fatty substances to lubricate and block them prevents wind from entering.
Salty and sour have a hot nature and can digest water, causing the body to become firm and solid, treating wind vacuity.

Cold and sweet are things like ghee and milk, which can treat heat.
In winter, one should take sweet and sour foods to remove wind.
For lung diseases, take fatty and greasy foods to block the pores and prevent water from entering.
Heat can scorch and spread water, thus it can cure lung diseases.
Eating too much triggers lung diseases. Since the food is abundant, the intestines and stomach are full, thus triggering the lungs.
Eating and digesting triggers heat. If the food is nourishing, then the heat illness subsides. When the food is digested without nourishment, the heat illness arises.
After digestion, the body becomes empty and hollow, and wind energy enters the body, thus triggering wind.
Wind is light and supple, ghee is fatty and greasy, and salt removes wind and sweetness removes heat. The lungs carry wind and water, so they should be expectorated.
